title: Chennai
text: The capital city of Tamil Nadu, known for Marina Beach, colonial landmarks, and vibrant culture.
itinerarydescription: Explore Chennai’s beaches, colonial history, Dravidian temples, and bustling markets while indulging in delicious South Indian cuisine.

title: Coimbatore
text: A major industrial hub known as the 'Manchester of South India', famous for its pleasant climate and textile industry.
itinerarydescription: Explore Coimbatore's serene landscapes, ancient temples, bustling markets, and vibrant textile industry while enjoying a pleasant climate.

title: Madurai
text: One of the oldest cities in India, home to the magnificent Meenakshi Amman Temple.
itinerarydescription: Discover Madurai’s rich history, ancient temples, lively streets, and delicious South Indian cuisine in this cultural heart of Tamil Nadu.

title: Tiruchirappalli
text: A historical city famous for the Rock Fort Temple and Srirangam Ranganathaswamy Temple.
itinerarydescription: Explore Trichy’s iconic Rock Fort, ancient temples, and vibrant culture while enjoying its scenic beauty and historical significance.

title: Salem
text: An important textile and steel city, also known for the Yercaud hill station.
itinerarydescription: Discover Salem’s thriving textile and steel industries, serene hill stations, and historic temples for a perfect mix of nature and heritage.

title: Kanyakumari
text: The southernmost tip of India, known for its Vivekananda Rock Memorial and sunrise views.
itinerarydescription: Witness stunning sunrise views, explore historic landmarks, and experience the confluence of three seas at Kanyakumari.

title: Thanjavur
text: Renowned for the Brihadeeswarar Temple and rich cultural heritage.
itinerarydescription: Immerse yourself in Thanjavur’s magnificent temples, vibrant art, and cultural heritage while exploring its historic landmarks.

title: Kanchipuram
text: Known as the 'City of a Thousand Temples' and famous for Kanchipuram silk sarees.
itinerarydescription: Explore Kanchipuram’s stunning temples, handwoven silk sarees, and deep spiritual heritage in this ancient city of Tamil Nadu.
